entry.title: Announcing paid plans for Math tools
entry.summary: Team Browserling keeps shipping! Last month we launched paid plans for Time Tools and today we're launching paid plans for our next most popular tool category â€“ Math Tools. Math tools are used by 20,000 people every month and they let you find divisors of numbers, generate primes, draw curves, generate random matrices, find Ï€, e, and Ï• digits, perform numerical calculations, and much more. Next, we're adding paid plans to all other online tools categories that we built and joining them into a single ultimate get things done website called OnlineTools.com, making it the top 100 website on the Internet. From technical standpoint, we used HTML templates, Google SEO, and a $5 Linode instance to launch the paid plans. Checkmate, front-end developers and devops engineers. You can still use all tools for free for a limited time but if you really like them, then you can get a subscription to support my team's work. See the pricing page for more information. Add paid plans too and see you next time!

entry.title: What is a URL Sandbox?
entry.summary: TLDR: A demo speaks louder than a thousand words. You can connect to a URL sandbox created by me and my team via browserling.com/browse. We run browsers in virtual machines and stream them to you as a video. This way, you can open suspicious URLs in a sandboxed environment without risking the security of your own computer. URL Sandbox â€“ What Is It? A URL sandbox is an isolated virtual environment used by cybersecurity professionals to analyze potentially malicious URLs and web content without compromising the primary network or endpoints. By executing suspicious links in a secure, controlled sandbox, threats like drive-by downloads, phishing pages, and weaponized documents can be safely identified and inspected before they reach users. URL sandboxing provides an essential layer of protectiâ€¦

entry.title: What's the difference between an .onion domain and a .com domain?
entry.summary: This is an excerpt from Browserling's Tor Browser Testing Guide. Browserling offers an online service for testing regular websites and onion websites in multiple Tor browser versions, which can be accessed via browserling.com/tor. The Tor browser is sandboxed in a virtual machine, runs on Browserling's servers, and is isolated from your device and network. Onion and Com Domains â€“ What's the difference? Both .onion and .com domains serve as top level domain identifiers for websites but they operate in very different environments and have distinct characteristics. Here's a comparison: Accessibility Onion domains can only be accessed through the Tor network, typically using the Tor browser or other Tor-enabled tools. Com domains are accessible from any standard web browser (such as Chrome or â€¦

entry.title: What is Remote Browser Isolation (RBI)?
entry.summary: TLDR: A demo speaks louder than a thousand words. You can connect to a remotely isolated browser created by me and my team via browserling.com/browse. We run remote browsers on our servers and stream just the browser window to you. Remote Browser Isolation â€“ What Is It? Remote Browser Isolation (RBI) is a cybersecurity technology that isolates web browsing activities from endpoint devices by executing web sessions on a remote server, typically in virtual machines or Docker containers. This approach effectively shields endpoints from browser-based threats like malware and phishing attacks by ensuring that only the browser window is transmitted to the user's device. RBI is particularly valuable in enterprise security, protecting against web-based threats. It's also useful in safeguarding agaâ€¦

entry.title: What is a Browser Emulator?
entry.summary: TLDR: A demo speaks louder than a thousand words. You can connect to a browser emulator created by me and my team via browserling.com/browse. We run browser emulators on our servers and stream just the browser window to you. Browser Emulator â€“ What Is It? A browser emulator is an application that mimics the functionality of a web browser, allowing developers to test how websites or web applications will perform across different browser environments without the need to have those browsers installed. It simulates various browser behaviors, including rendering styles, user agent strings, and JavaScript interpretation, aiding in cross-browser compatibility testing and debugging. How are Browser Emulators Used in Web Development? Browser emulators are used in web development for testing and debâ€¦

entry.title: What is a Safe Browser?
entry.summary: TLDR: A demo speaks louder than a thousand words. You can connect to a safe browser created by me and my team via browserling.com/browse. We run safe browsers on our servers and stream just the browser window to you. Safe Browser â€“ What Is It? A safe browser refers to a web browser (such as Chrome or Firefox) that operates in a controlled, isolated environment, preventing malware and other malicious scripts from affecting the user's main operating system. These browsers are essential in cybersecurity as they allow to safely examine and interact with potentially harmful content, such as suspicious links, websites, and files without risking the integrity of the primary system or network. What are a Safe Browser Use Cases? Safe browsers are utilized for a wide range of cybersecurity applicatiâ€¦
